runs.comm: starts full outside off, hint of swing, driven down to mid-on
well bowled, full at Hales' toes with swing and he digs it out
ooh, driven into the off side and Hales set off straight away but a clean pick up by Sammy at midwicket would have caused problems
full outside leg stump and clipped away down to fine leg...nice easy start for Kieswetter
pushed across Kieswetter who leaves alone
good line to finish with, on middle and and off which is defended into the covers
offers up some width to start with but Hales can't beat cover
big appeal, well sort of! Hales went for a sweep and Sammy was up straight away at slip for a bottom edge but the bowler wasn't very interested
chopped into the off side
now he goes for a reverse sweep and misses...he's not the best starter against spin
stands outside leg stump and tucks this away through midwicket
fired in very full, dug out into the off side and cover is fairly deep
nicely bowled, beats Kieswetter with a slower ball that grips on the surface
lovely drive, was in the slot outside off stump and he leans into in with timing and placement
comes onto the front front and opens the face to play to third man

gone! Lovely delivery, does Hales with a slower ball, he played too early and across the line. It takes out off stump. West Indies take their first wicket of the series. Hales didn't look so comfortable tonight
touch wide outside off, cut away out to the cover sweeper
well bowled again, another slower ball and it beats Kieswetter's attempted glide to third man
touch short, Stokes goes for a pull and doesn't connect...gets taken on the back leg
gone! Another goes. This one slides on with the arm and takes the off stump as Kieswetter tries to cut. He stood for a moment, asking if the keeper broke the stumps, but was soon on his way
onto the back foot and pushed into the off side
takes the pad into the big gap at midwicket
stays around the wicket, whipped off the back foot through midwicket
straightens a touch on Bopara who plays it back to the bowler...really nice over
comes down the pitch but can only cut this down to third man
this time the slower ball gets Bopara in trouble as a leading edge loops into the off side
this time he finds the edge, it gripped off the surface, and Russell makes good ground at third man
strangled appeal, this swung late into Bopara who got into a bit of a tangle but the ball would have missed leg stump
pushed towards leg stump but Stokes can't take advantage
offers up some width which allows Stokes to free his arms through the off side but there's a sweeper on the boundary
driven off the back foot into the covers
angled towards leg stump, takes the pad towards square leg
goes across Stokes from round the wicket, pushed square on the off side
beauty! That's a ripper from Mathurin which turns past the edge of Bopara's bat and takes off stump. He was on the back foot and maybe should have been forward, but superb bowling
left alone outside off
touch short, allows Bairstow to work it into the midwicket area and he's rapid between the wickets
touch short, Stokes onto the back foot and drills it hard through the off side
turn from outside off, beats Stokes on the front foot and he's taken on the pad
that relieves some of the pressure, takes this from well outside off stump with good footwork and launches it over long on
now he brings out the reverse sweep and places it past short third man...that's confidence
quicker ball and it's punched firmly to cover
that's superb, stayed on the back foot and punched it wide of mid-off who was still inside the circle...excellent timing
ooh, he's beaten by a quicker ball as he jabs outside off stump
goes across the crease, takes this from outside off and places it perfectly through midwicket. Bairstow is so quick.
gone! Bairstow won't be seeing England home tonight. He goes across his stumps again, this time to sweep, exposes his stumps and misses the shot. What an evening for Mathurin
this one doesn't turn and it's played to mid-on
waits on the back foot and guides it square through the off side
flicked off leg stump down to short fine leg
hint of turn from a full length and played square on the off side
punched off the back foot to cover
lovely stuff, beats Patel with one that turns sharply
comes forward and defends with bat and pad together
gets away with one he drops short, Patel pulls it hard but straight to deep midwicket
worked along the ground through midwicket so he keeps the strike
starts with a loopy slower ball outside off and Stokes was so deceived he just left it alone
that's power! Dropped short by Sammy and Stokes latches on with a crisp pull which wasn't that far from long on
calmly pushed down the ground to long off

another goes! Patel is well out here. Direct hit from backward point and he's well short. Inspired from West Indies, a little slow from Samit. It looped off the pad into the off side and he didn't seem sure where it was straight away and the throw was spot on
edge of the seat stuff now as Stokes chips this one just over the head of cover and almost times it well enough for four
worked into the leg side, doesn't find the gap
Bishoo slips one straight on with the arm, Stokes stepping forward in defence
and again. Not much flight or spin from Bishoo, but it's enough to keep Stokes quite
Bishoo strings three dots together in a row, and the pressure is on Stokes now. He's done alright so far
there goes another one! Bishoo strikes as Stokes attempts to break the shackles with a shuffle and a sweep. He's struck on the front pad and England are six down as the appeal is upheld!
Bresnan is off the mark straight away, stepping back to nudge a single to cover
nicely looped by Bishoo, and the ball grips and spins as Buttler presses forward with his bat angle. Bresnan wants a single, but there's none to be had and he's sent back
he starts with a length delivery on off stump that's patted into the covers
great shot from Buttler, who threads the off side field off the back foot, but there's a committed piece of fielding by the cover sweeper to save two runs
Russell continues to plug away on an off stump line, and manages to keep Buttler quiet

almost caught and bowled! This was a mighty tough chance. It didn't appear to be a much slower ball, it just stuck in the surface as Buttler stepped onto the front foot. Russell leapt to his left in his follow through but could only get a palm to it. Really tough. It's hard to call that a drop
tight stuff from Russell, Bresnan defending

Russell strikes! West Indies are right on top as Bresnan falls, courtesy of a superb diving, sliding catch at long off. The shot wasn't really on with the man out, but Bresnan attempted to loft down the ground, only for Mathurin - who is having quite a night - to charge in and scoop the ball up close to the turf
he's off the mark straight away, nudging down the ground
Buttler follows suit, driving to long off
flicked into the leg side, where it's stopped inside the circle. Buttler wanted a single and had to scramble to get back to his crease
shot! Smith offers width outside off and Borthwick puts it past point with a crisp cut. There was a man out in the deep, but his dive was in vain as the ball zipped past him
Smith aims full on leg stump, and Borthwick can't connect with the leg glance
chopped down just behind square by Borthwick, one run the result
Russell slams one down short of a length, and Borthwick is back and across to defend to cover. There's not much life in this pitch, it just appears the ball is sticking in the surface a touch
another rising delivery from Russell, and this time Borthwick angles the bat to send the ball to third man
much too short from Russell, who bends his back but slams the ball down at his feet. He's rightly called for the wide as the ball sails over Buttler's head
much better. Russell hits a length and Buttler nudges to cover

shovelled through cover! Buttler must have very strong arms, he's absolutely hammered this drive. The shot was on as the ball slipped out as a long half-volley, but he really nailed it. And placed it too
the slower one from Russell, a low, dipping full toss, and it's worked into the leg side
another slower one - a legcutter by the looks of things - and Buttler hangs back to flick it off his pads

although this has tilted things slightly further in England's favour! Smith floated one up very full and wide of off, and Borthwick just caressed it through cover. Didn't over hit it, just made sure to get his balance and timing right
Smith trundles in from round the wicket, and draws a defensive stroke from Borthwick with a straight length delivery
nicely whipped into the leg side, they think about a second run but wisely turn it down
pushed through mid-off for one

the match turns again! Buttler has been run out by a fantastic piece of fielding by the West Indies captain. Borthwick had tried to work another single through mid on, but Sammy charged round even as Buttler wandered out of his crease. He was quickly sent back by Borthwick, but Sammy fired in the throw and rattled the stumps with Buttler inches short. West Indies celebrate!
clipped off the toes to midwicket, and there's a roar of disapproval from Sammy as he dives over the ball without stopping it, giving away a single
beaten outside off! Sammy slings down an offcutter that bounces a little more than expected, the ball rising past Borthwick's poking bat

collision! Borthwick nudges into space close to the wicket and Swann wants a single. He's sent back as Sammy sprints after the ball, captain crashing into captain as Swann scurries back to his crease, getting in the way of the shy (a manoeuvre which will be outlawed in a few day's time). Sammy is down and looks to be in a little pain, but both men offer raised palms in apology. No harm done.
beaten once more outside off! Borthwick had a slash but couldn't get a touch on it. Swann wanders down to give him a calming word in the ear
now he does get the single
full on off stump, Swann comes forward to drive but hits the field

another run out! Swann pushed to cover once more and Borthwick charged out of the blocks. Swann went nowhere, and by the time Borthwick turned back the ball was already being thrown back to Sammy. West Indies close in on a morale-boosting win.
beaten on the outside edge! Dernbach leaned tentatively foward but the ball gripped and ripped past his defensive bat
a typcially ungainly slash into the off side from Dernbach, and they're back for the second as the return throw hits the keeper's pads and rolls to fine leg
cracked hard to extra cover off the back foot

a sliding delivery goes on with the arm as Dernbach steps back to clip to leg ... they push hard for the second run, Swann calling Dernbach across immediately, but the throw is on target and Christian has the bails off in a flash. Dernbach is short, he's out, West Indies win! They had all wandered back to their positions, they didn't think it was that close. A wide smile spready across Sammy's face as the decision flashed up on the big screen, which is wonderful to see
